meanings.definition: The quality or state of being recursive.
meanings.sent1: The recursiveness of the pattern made it easy to predict the next shape in the sequence.
meanings.sent2: The programmer's code demonstrated the recursiveness needed to solve the complex problem.
meanings.sent3: The recursiveness of the maze design led to a fun and challenging experience for the players.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling had a recursiveness that looped the listener back to the beginning, creating a sense of deja vu.
meanings.sent5: The recursiveness of the song's melody made it impossible to get out of your head.

meanings.definition: The act or process of repeating or returning.
meanings.sent1: The recursiveness of the echo in the cave was both eerie and fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The recursiveness of the waves hitting the shore was calming to watch.
meanings.sent3: The recursiveness of the joke had everyone laughing long after it was told.
meanings.sent4: The recursiveness of the clock's ticking symbolized the never-ending passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The recursiveness of the dance routine made it mesmerizing to watch.
